channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: More than 100 homes damaged by tornado near Houston
item.description: More than 100 homes were damaged after a tornado touched down in a residential area outside Houston. Authorities said Monday that no injuries were reported.
item.content:encoded:
More than 100 homes were damaged after a tornado touched down in a residential area outside Houston. Authorities said Monday that no injuries were reported.

(Image credit: Brett Coomer/Houston Chronicle)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: As the ranks of hunters in the U.S. shrink, these kids are keeping tradition alive
item.description: The number of hunters in the U.S. continues to drop. Some states run events to get more kids interested in the sport. We join a pheasant hunt in Connecticut.
item.content:encoded: The number of hunters in the U.S. continues to drop. Some states run events to get more kids interested in the sport. We join a pheasant hunt in Connecticut.
item.dc:creator: Aine Pennello

item.title: Portland Trail Blazers coach pleads not guilty in rigged poker games case
item.description: Hall of Famer Chauncey Billups has pleaded not guilty to charges he profited from rigged poker games involving several Mafia figures and another former NBA player.
item.content:encoded:
Hall of Famer Chauncey Billups has pleaded not guilty to charges he profited from rigged poker games involving several Mafia figures and another former NBA player.

(Image credit: Yuki Iwamura)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'Just Google' me: Slender Man stabber is recaptured after fleeing her group home
item.description: Geyser and a friend lured a classmate to the woods and stabbed her 19 times in 2014. She moved from a psychiatric facility to a group home in Wisconsin earlier this year.
item.content:encoded:
Geyser and a friend lured a classmate to the woods and stabbed her 19 times in 2014. She moved from a psychiatric facility to a group home in Wisconsin earlier this year.

(Image credit: Morry Gash)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Judge tosses Comey, James cases after finding prosecutor unlawfully appointed
item.description: The judge's decision on the appointment of Lindsey Halligan marks a significant setback to efforts to go after the president's perceived political enemies.
item.content:encoded:
The judge's decision on the appointment of Lindsey Halligan marks a significant setback to efforts to go after the president's perceived political enemies.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Virginia's tough rules for felons to regain their voting rights could soon be changing
item.description: Virginia is one of just a few states where only the governor can restore voting rights for people with felony convictions. But Virginia's rules may soon be changing.
item.content:encoded:
Virginia is one of just a few states where only the governor can restore voting rights for people with felony convictions. But Virginia's rules may soon be changing.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Dean Mirshahi

item.title: 'Nobody wants to come': What if the U.S. can no longer attract immigrant physicians?
item.description: Immigrants make up a significant proportion of all the country's doctors. New policies are making it harder and less appealing for foreign-born physicians to come to the U.S.
item.content:encoded: Immigrants make up a significant proportion of all the country's doctors. New policies are making it harder and less appealing for foreign-born physicians to come to the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: THC drinks are flying high. A new hemp law could kill the buzz
item.description: Drinks infused with cannabis' buzzy compound THC are wildly popular and available in many states. But a year from now, the hemp-based products could be banned under a newly approved federal law.
item.content:encoded:
Drinks infused with cannabis' buzzy compound THC are wildly popular and available in many states. But a year from now, the hemp-based products could be banned under a newly approved federal law.

(Image credit: Ryan Wiramidjaja)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: The U.S. labels Venezuela's Cartel de los Soles as a terrorist group led by Maduro
item.description: The Trump's administration has ramped up pressure on Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro by designating the Cartel de los Soles as a foreign terrorist organization.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump's administration has ramped up pressure on Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro by designating the Cartel de los Soles as a foreign terrorist organization.

(Image credit: Cristian Hernandez)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The U.S. Transportation Department is urging air passengers to be on good behavior
item.description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy wants air travelers to be nice this holiday season. A new DOT campaign asks passengers to help each other and thank flight attendants.
item.content:encoded:
Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy wants air travelers to be nice this holiday season. A new DOT campaign asks passengers to help each other and thank flight attendants.

(Image credit: Robert Alexander)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright
